title: Explainable artificial intelligence identifies an AQP4 polymorphism-based risk score associated with brain amyloid burden

finding: The carrier status of SNP rs3875089 was linked to slower cognitive decline in dementia progression, indicating its significance in the Alzheimer's disease trajectory.
title: Explainable artificial intelligence identifies an AQP4 polymorphism-based risk score associated with brain amyloid burden

finding: Found upstream of MEP1B yet significant in the plasminogen activation pathway, implicating it in complex regulatory systems.
title: Mapping pQTLs of circulating inflammatory proteins identifies drivers of immune-related disease risk and novel therapeutic targets

finding: The SNP "rs946934582" was identified with a p-value of 2.764e-144, indicating a very strong association with gestational ages in the study. It was linked as a genomic risk locus and contributed to the understanding of genetic associations of the gestational age trait in fetal embryo samples.
title: Ultra-low coverage genome-wide association study - insights into gestational age using 17,844 embryo samples with preimplantation genetic testing

finding: The SNP rs11081057 was linked to the prognostic stratification of HPV-positive head and neck squamous cell carcinoma. In the study by Locati et al. (2019), expression patterns correlated with the prognosis of HPV-mediated oropharyngeal cancer were analyzed, highlighting its significance in clinical outcomes.
title: Using digital spatial profiling to analyse onco-immune-related gene expression within oropharyngeal tumours in relation to HPV and p16 status

finding: The variant rs10502966 at locus 18q21.2 was associated with chronotype and putamen volume, suggesting significant pleiotropic effects on brain disorders.
title: The role of sleep in the human brain and body: insights from multi-organ imaging genetics

finding: This variant rs6506878, located in SALL3, was found through the meta-analysis to be significantly associated with PSA levels, emphasizing the importance of genetic testing in screening.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: This SNP was associated with SALL3 and showed significance in linking to PSA levels, enhancing the understanding of prostate cancer risk.
title: Incorporating Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Improves Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The rare variant rs184097503 (MAF=0.4%) was associated with a more than 50% decreased risk for polymyalgia rheumatica, with an OR of 0.43.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The missense variant rs28933981 (p.T139M) was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs184097503 and is associated with transthyretin amyloid cardiomyopathy.
title: Genetic architecture and shared mechanisms of common ‘neglected’ diseases

finding: The rs7241199 SNP showed a significant association with CHMP1B expression and the regulation of IFNB1 during Mtb infection, illustrating its importance in cytokine induction.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: This variant was associated exclusively with traits in the AFR population, with a significant association indicated by MTAG p=1.6×10^-9.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: For SNP rs112836568, which was found within the CD226 gene, the analysis indicated it had a maximum DIS greater than 2, suggesting it might be related to disease-associated mutations.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The intergenic SNP rs5007436 was associated with the NANOG / FOXA1 class, indicating it had cell type-specific transcription factor activity implicated in tumour development. It demonstrated significant regulatory potential.
title: Novel discoveries and enhanced genomic prediction from modelling genetic risk of cancer age-at-onset

finding: The SNP rs2276182 located within the POLI gene was discovered to have a colocalisation relationship with lung adenocarcinoma and LTL. POLI is known for its functions in DNA repair and its involvement in translesion synthesis, potentially linking its genetic variant to increased cancer susceptibility.
title: Common genetic variations in telomere length genes and lung cancer

finding: Identified as significant in the cardiometabolic joint test with a p-value of 1.8×10^-10, this variant showed strong genetic effects in individuals with obesity (OR = 2.36) and exerted weaker effects in those with T2D. It highlighted potential interactions affecting COVID-19 outcomes tied to metabolic status.
title: Gene-environment interaction analysis incorporating sex, cardiometabolic diseases, and multiple deprivation index reveals novel genetic associations with COVID-19 severity

finding: The SNP rs6567160 was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) with a beta of 0.018 and a P-value of 4.1 × 10^-10, indicating a significant relationship with this metabolic disorder.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs891387 was associated with BMI with a beta of 0.021 and a P-value of 9.3 × 10^-35, confirming its significance in influencing BMI.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: The SNP rs1788819 showed an association with T2D, with a beta of 0.032 and a P-value of 4 × 10^-21, illustrating its impact on the risk of developing T2D.
title: Population scale whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into cardiometabolic health

finding: This SNP indicated a suggestive association with CSF amyloid-β levels, consistent with its significance in MRI and cognitive measures.
title: Genome Wide Analysis Across Alzheimer’s Disease Endophenotypes: Main Effects and Stage Specific Interactions

finding: The SNP rs975903 was associated with higher expression of the gene SMAD4 in ischemic stroke (IS) subjects. Specifically, those with the GG allele of this SNP exhibited significantly higher SMAD4 expression at all time points after stroke, which related to inflammatory processes and hypercoagulation associated with poor 90-day functional outcomes (as measured by the modified Rankin Scale, mRS). Furthermore, SMAD4 expression was linked to blood-brain barrier disruption and previously noted to be up-regulated in IS patients who later developed hemorrhagic transformation. Thus, this finding indicated that the rs975903 SNP could serve as a significant genetic marker in relation to post-stroke outcomes.
title: Peripheral Blood Gene Expression at 3 to 24 Hours Correlates with and Predicts 90-Day Outcome Following Human Ischemic Stroke

finding: This TCF4 variant interacted with LTST affecting HDL-c, which further confirms its novel association with lipid traits and sleep.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The SNP rs2156008 was also identified as a novel locus associated with smoking initiation in the same meta-analysis. Positioned at 18q21.2 within the TCF4 gene, it showed a beta value of 0.01 (SE = 0.002) with genome-wide significance (P = 3.21 × 10^-8). This gene is related to nervous system development, and the findings implicate it in the initiation of smoking behaviors.
title: Evaluation of the Causal Relationship Between Smoking and Schizophrenia in Asia

finding: SNP rs56235016, an intergenic variant in CTDP1, was confirmed for its association with substance use traits.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The rs7238033 SNP was associated with bladder cancer and identified among four polymorphisms located on chromosome 18q12.3, which was shown to be significantly vulnerable to the disease.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The rs10775480 SNP was linked to an increased risk of bladder cancer and was included among four polymorphisms at the chromosome 18q12.3 locus.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The rs11082469 SNP was identified in association with bladder cancer, found within the four polymorphisms located on chromosome 18q12.3.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: The rs17674580 SNP was detected at the 18q12.3 locus, contributing to the genetic susceptibility of bladder cancer.
title: A systematic review of genome-wide association studies on bladder cancer

finding: A significant association was identified with a p-value of 2.50E-10, related to traits of risk-taking, as it is located in the TCF4 gene, which has prior associations with various psychiatric conditions.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: Found significant association (p=3.80E-12) within TCF4, previously linked to several psychiatric conditions, including risk-taking behavior.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: This SNP was found to be significantly associated with Subtype III, linking it to rapid symptom progression in patients.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: NEDD4L rs4503880 was part of a significant gene-gene interaction with ZNF827 rs4835265, affecting gamma glutamyltransferase levels.
title: Hypothesis-free detection of gene-interaction effects on biomarker concentration in UK Biobank using variance prioritisation

finding: The SNP rs946934582 was identified in the study with a p-value of 2.764e-144, indicating a significant association with gestational ages. This finding contributed to the establishment of 11 genomic risk loci related to gestational age in a sample of Chinese fetal embryos.
title: Ultra-low coverage genome-wide association study – insights into gestational age using 17,844 embryo samples with preimplantation genetic testing

finding: The intronic variant rs9944845 in SETBP1 was significantly associated with sensation seeking in all gene-based analyses, highlighting its relevance as a novel finding related to neurobiological functions.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: The variant rs4239453 within CDH2 was associated with sensation seeking and emphasized its role in cell-to-cell adhesion, further demonstrating its neurobiological importance.
title: Neurogenetic and multi-omic sources of overlap among sensation seeking, alcohol consumption, and alcohol use disorder

finding: The weak JK*A allele (JK*A01W.01 - rs2298720) was found to be associated with a weakened expression of Jk antigen and potentially capable of causing alloimmunization when mistyped as JkNULL. The allele's frequency was noted to be overwhelmingly low in Middle Easterners at 7%, compared to higher frequencies in other populations.
title: A comprehensive characterization of blood group antigen variants in the Middle Eastern population genomes - Insights into genetic epidemiology

finding: The SNP rs729053 was identified as the leading SNP of the second most significant locus (locus 17) in the GWAS, associated with the TCF4 gene on chromosome 18.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs8085882 was unique to the case-control GWAS and associated with ADHD, with the closest gene being ZNF521, which has been linked to educational attainment, ADHD, and smoking initiation.
title: ADuLT: An efficient and robust time-to-event GWAS

finding: In the context of cross-ancestry analysis, rs12457101 demonstrated significant associations with anxiety traits, with a p-value of 2.1×10^-9 in the EUR group and a p-value of 0.008 in the SAS group, indicating its role in anxiety across different ancestries.
title: Gene Discovery and Biological Insights into Anxiety Disorders from a Multi-Ancestry Genome-wide Association Study of >1.2 Million Participants

finding: The intergenic SNP rs6507215, located near the VRK1 gene on chromosome 14, was associated with impulsivity, particularly linked to alcohol consumption and insomnia, with a P-omnibus of 1.25e-8.
title: The pleiotropic architecture of human impulsivity across biological scales

finding: The SNP rs12964203 was associated with Body Mass Index (BMI) in a genome-wide association study (GWAS), showing a genome-wide significant p-value of 4.3E-10 and a beta value of 0.08, indicating a positive correlation with BMI.
title: Improved Type 2 Diabetes Risk Stratification in the Qatar Biobank Cohort by Ensemble Learning Classifier Incorporating Multi-Trait, Population-Specific, Polygenic Risk Scores

finding: The SNP rs11874212 tagged a novel genome-wide significant locus on chromosome 18 associated with mean BMI levels, and was linked to the protein coding gene TSHZ1 and the lncRNA RP11-17M16. This finding suggested an influence on weight regulation in the context of HD.
title: Clinical and genetic association studies reveal within-individual variability as an integral part of Huntington disease

finding: The SNP rs11150911 at the chromosome 18 locus was noted for its previous associations with BMI and body weight in population-based cohorts, thus reinforcing its relevance in the context of weight modulation in HD.
title: Clinical and genetic association studies reveal within-individual variability as an integral part of Huntington disease

finding: The SNP rs12964145 was also associated with the chromosome 18 locus, sharing previous associations with BMI and body weight, indicating its potential role as a genetic modifier in Huntington disease.
title: Clinical and genetic association studies reveal within-individual variability as an integral part of Huntington disease

finding: The SNP rs673939 was associated with the ONECUT2 gene locus on chromosome 18 and was identified as the strongest signal among four new loci with a P value of 1.29 × 10-9. This finding was newly identified in this study, suggesting a potential role for the ONECUT2 gene in the mechanisms underlying headaches.
title: A meta-analysis of the genome-wide association studies on two genetically correlated phenotypes (self-reported headache and self-reported migraine) identifies four new risk loci for headaches (N=397,385)

finding: The study reported that the degree centrality at the left calcarine was negatively associated with UPDRS-III scores in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients who did not carry the A allele of AQP4 rs162009. It was noted that autonomic dysfunction had an impact on this association and the cognitive decline observed in PD patients may also contribute to motor impairment.
title: Both brain network topology and striatal dopamine depletion mediate the effects of autonomic dysfunction on disease burden of Parkinson’s disease

finding: The variant rs78851735 in the MBP gene was associated with increased TAA prevalence, with a significant p-value of 3.79 x 10^-8 and an odds ratio of 3.446.
title: Analysis of UK Biobank Cohort Reveals Novel Insights for Thoracic and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

finding: SNP rs657693 was identified as a cis-pQTL for NFATC1, associated with 16 other proteins in ratios. This highlighted a network of related proteins that could support immunosuppressive drug development, revealing novel interactions linked through genetic evidence.
title: Genetic associations with ratios between protein levels detect new pQTLs and reveal protein-protein interactions

finding: The c.130G>A variant defined the JK*A02W.03 allele, which was a known polymorphism with a minor allele frequency (MAF) greater than 0.05, indicating its commonality. This allele was linked to weak allele expression in the Kidd blood group, but further evidence did not support significant discrepancies related to it.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group system using long-read nanopore sequencing

finding: Identified as c.191G>A, this SNP was phased to the JK*A01/02 background allele, contributing to allele JK*A02N.09. It was documented as a known variant in the analysis.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group system using long-read nanopore sequencing

finding: The c.742G>A variant was noted as defining the JK*A01W.05 allele, which carried known weak typing but was also recognized to potentially cause null phenotypes in certain contexts.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group system using long-read nanopore sequencing

finding: The c.871T>C variant was identified and associated with the JK*A02N.06 allele, confirming its status as a known SNP in the context of the Kidd blood group.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group system using long-read nanopore sequencing

finding: As c.956C>T, this SNP was relevant as it was phased to the JK*A02N.08 allele, marking it as a recognized variant contributing to the genetic landscape of the Kidd blood group.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group system using long-read nanopore sequencing

finding: The c.725G>A variant was newly reported in the context of a null allele within the Kidd blood group system. It remained unlisted by the ISBT despite being identified in previous sequencing in European populations.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group system using long-read nanopore sequencing

finding: The c.119G>A variant was recognized as a novel SNP associated with null phenotypes and represented a unique change related to the amino acid Gly40, marking it as significant in the study.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group system using long-read nanopore sequencing

finding: The variant c.118G>A was noted for its known association with null alleles JK*A01N.17 and JK*A02N.21, illuminating its relevance in the context of Kidd blood group genetics.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group system using long-read nanopore sequencing

finding: The SNP rs17782313 was identified as a differential enhancer for the MC4R gene, being the second top obesity-associated SNP from GWAS. It was located 187k bp from MC4R and was found to potentially disrupt GATA1 binding, which regulates MC4R expression. The knockout of its enhancer sequence led to a 60% reduction in MC4R expression in differentiated neurons.
title: Integrative single-cell characterization of hypothalamus sex-differential and obesity-associated genes and regulatory elements

finding: The SNP rs11081097 was reported to be associated with the immune response, specifically relating to the role of Apolipoprotein A-I (ApoA-I) in immunity, inflammation, and cancer, as noted in the work of Georgila et al. in 2019. This finding highlighted the relevance of ApoA-I in immune responses, particularly in the context of intestinal health.
title: Spatial expression programs of the intestinal follicle-associated epithelium

finding: Variant rs73392121 was located within a microglia scATAC peak and predicted to regulate NPC1. The alternative allele led to reduced enhancer activity, associated with Niemann-Pick disease type C.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: This SNP caused an alteration in its binding motif that resulted in a differential binding affinity of the RBP PTBP1 compared to its WT counterpart.
title: Effect of Single Nucleotide Polymorphisms on the structure of long noncoding RNAs and their interaction with RNA Binding Proteins

finding: The variant rs4797876 was linked to sulcal depth and the gene <italic>ROCK1P1</italic>, highlighting its role in brain morphology and neurocognitive traits.
title: Gene expansions contributing to human brain evolution

finding: The SNP rs8091497 was identified as having the largest transcription factor binding affinity change, leading to a 40-fold decline in binding for SP1, a factor linked to behavioral abnormalities in schizophrenia.
title: Unveiling causal regulatory mechanisms through cell-state parallax

finding: The variant rs2229616 (p.Val103Ile) in the GPRC6A gene was associated with body size phenotypes and immature reticulocyte fraction, marking it as a gain-of-function variant affecting β-arrestin signaling.
title: Medical relevance of common protein-altering variants in GPCR genes across 337,205 individuals in the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs9960767 was located within a super-FIRE identified in human hippocampus tissue, which demonstrated high frequent local chromatin interactions. This region largely overlapped with the gene TCF4, which is important for neurodevelopment. The findings suggested that chromatin spatial organization may significantly influence gene regulation at this locus, potentially elucidating the mechanism by which rs9960767 affects the risk of schizophrenia.
title: FIREcaller: Detecting Frequently Interacting Regions from Hi-C Data

finding: The SNP rs17799413 was predicted to associate with decreased CDH19 expression by altering TEAD1 binding in non-myelinating Schwann cells. The significant slope in analysis indicated a direct influence on gene expression regulation.
title: NetREm: Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs11663049 was linked to decreased risk of polyneuropathy in diabetes and showed a significant correlation with reduced CEP192 expression, suggesting it modulates transcription factor binding related to this gene.
title: NetREm: Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The rs763361 SNP, which results in a G307S mutation in the DNAM-1 immunoreceptor, was identified as a gain-of-function mutation associated with enhanced pro-inflammatory cytokine production in CD4+ T cells. It was shown that CD4+ T cells from rs763361 carriers demonstrated significantly increased phosphorylation of downstream signaling molecules, including IL-17 production, compared to non-carriers. This variant was linked to various autoimmune diseases such as multiple sclerosis, type 1 diabetes, and rheumatoid arthritis, and directly contributed to the exacerbation of autoimmune responses in models of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis.
title: G307S DNAM-1 mutation exacerbates autoimmune encephalomyelitis via enhancing CD4+ T cell activation

finding: The SNP rs139941105, an A>G single nucleotide polymorphism located at GRCh38:50530925 intergenic region, was reported in humans with a minor allele frequency of 0.01. Its presence was noted during the deep sequencing analysis which showed that ABE8e treatment resulted in this site having 4 times more substitutions in base-edited HEK<sup>W53X/W53X</sup> cells compared to untreated controls. However, this SNP was characterized as having no known clinical significance.
title: Nonviral base editing of KCNJ13 mutation preserves vision in an inherited retinal channelopathy

finding: The SNP rs1893217, associated with the PTPN2 gene, was found to be significant in relation to inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). It was demonstrated that patients carrying the rs1893217 allele showed altered microbiomes and an increased presence of Proteobacteria, including adherent-invasive E. coli (AIEC). In experimental models, Ptpn2-deficient mice displayed substantial shifts in intestinal microbiome composition favoring the proliferation of a novel AIEC that shared over 90% genomic similarity with LF82, a strain previously linked to IBD. This finding indicated that the PTPN2 risk allele was directly related to alterations in gut microbiota dynamics and contributed to IBD pathogenesis.
title: The Autoimmune Susceptibility Gene, PTPN2, Restricts Expansion of a Novel Mouse Adherent-Invasive E. coli

finding: The SNP rs17758695 in the gene BCL2 was found to have a significantly increased association with LOY, with its P-value for association improving from P_mLRR-Y=7.5×10^-65 to P_PAR-LOY=4.1×10^-147, indicating a strong genetic determinant of LOY amongst the studied male population.
title: Genetic predisposition to mosaic Y chromosome loss in blood is associated with genomic instability in other tissues and susceptibility to non-haematological cancers

finding: The study found that rs9952980, an rSNP located in an intron of the gene SLC14A2, was shown to significantly affect ERα binding at an estrogen response element (ERE). Specifically, it was predicted to decrease ERα’s binding affinity, thereby leading to reduced expression of SLC14A2, with clinical data indicating that carriers of the alternative T allele had a lower risk of developing breast cancer compared to homozygous carriers of the reference C allele.
title: Breast cancer risk SNPs converge on estrogen receptor binding sites commonly shared between breast tumors to locally alter estrogen signalling output

finding: The SNP rs11081126 was associated with the modulation of gene expression as discussed in relation to the Hedgehog signaling pathway in breast cancer. This connection highlighted its potential relevance in understanding the aging phenotype in luminal epithelia, which was a significant factor in increasing susceptibility to breast cancer.
title: Luminal epithelial cells integrate variable responses to aging into stereotypical changes that underlie breast cancer susceptibility

finding: The rs12456492 SNP within the RIT2 gene was originally associated with Parkinson's disease (PD) in a 2011 GWAS study. Subsequent studies, including a meta-analysis, confirmed its association with PD. In this context, it was found to influence the correlation between RIT2 and SYT4 gene expression and brain pH specifically in the substantia nigra. In the BrainEAC dataset, significant interactions were observed: individuals carrying the risk AG and GG alleles showed a positive correlation between gene expression and pH, whereas this was not the case for AA genotype individuals. This suggested a protective effect against the coupling of pH and gene expression in those with the AA genotype.
title: A pH-eQTL interaction at the RIT2-SYT4 Parkinson’s disease risk locus in the substantia nigra

finding: The variant rs10502347 was associated with the LAMA1 locus and was part of the 99% credible set in fine-mapping data from the DIAMANTE consortium. It was found to overlap an ATAC-seq peak and ChIP-seq sites for pancreatic transcription factors. Additionally, the T2D risk allele 'C' was predicted to disrupt SOX9 binding, indicating its potential impact on T2D via regulation of pancreatic developmental processes.
title: Pancreatic progenitor epigenome maps prioritize type 2 diabetes risk genes with roles in development

finding: The SNP rs11081056 was associated with the EPAS1 gene, which demonstrated significance in reducing susceptibility to chronic mountain sickness among Himalayan highlanders. This finding was pivotal as it highlighted the role of archaic introgression from Denisovans in shaping adaptive responses to hypobaric hypoxia, crucial for survival in high-altitude environments.
title: Archaic introgression contributed to shape the adaptive modulation of angiogenesis and nitric oxide induction in human high-altitude populations from the Himalayas

finding: This SNP showed opposing associations with luminal A-like (OR=1.03) and triple-negative subtypes (OR=0.95), marking it as significant in marker-specific analyses for ER (P=2.8×10^-3) and tumor grade (P=2.8×10^-4), thus demonstrating the complexity of genetic susceptibility across breast cancer subtypes.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: This SNP was identified at the BCL2A locus, associated with muscle (TOA=0.52) and adipose (TOA=0.48) tissue profiles, indicating shared effects.
title: A multi-omic integrative scheme characterizes tissues of action at loci associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The study found that the index case carried the G allele of variant rs2847297 at the PTPN2 locus, which is recognized as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) previously associated with rheumatoid arthritis. Reduced PTPN2 transcription from the rs2847297-G allele was linked to lower expression of TC-PTP and greater persistence of pSTAT1 in the index case compared to his mother, elucidating the variable disease penetrance in the family.
title: Whole Genome Sequencing of Primary Immunodeficiency reveals a role for common and rare variants in coding and non-coding sequences

finding: The SNP rs11665282 in the MOCOS gene was notably significant for schizophrenia (p=1.48×10^-7). It was implicated in vascular endothelial functions and served as a cis-eQTL in various brain regions, highlighting its potential role in SCZ and vascular health.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The SNP rs543759 was also linked to type 2 diabetes with a p-value of 2.904 x 10^-6. Similar to rs597414, it was selected by block HSIC Lasso for its contribution to classification accuracy, even with a low p-value that did not meet the conservative Bonferroni threshold.
title: Block HSIC Lasso: model-free biomarker detection for ultra-high dimensional data

finding: The functional single nucleotide polymorphism (rs7964) in the gene encoding the enzyme phosphatidylethanolamine N-methyltransferase (PEMT) was found to be associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD). This association suggested that abnormalities in endogenous choline production due to this SNP may lead to an increased incidence of AD, indicating the potential role of dietary choline intake in mitigating AD risk.
title: Dietary choline intake is necessary to prevent systems-wide organ pathology and reduce Alzheimer’s disease hallmarks

finding: The SNP rs17755942 was associated with natural selection evident from a higher iHS score of 3.5517 in HM people, suggesting a specific adaptation related to immune function.
title: Genomic insights into the population history and biological adaptation of Southwestern Chinese Hmong-Mien people

finding: The SNP rs1237775 demonstrated strong natural selection with an iHS score of 3.4758 in HM people, indicating its significance in adaptive traits.
title: Genomic insights into the population history and biological adaptation of Southwestern Chinese Hmong-Mien people

finding: The SNP rs16920 presented a high iHS score of 3.3540 in HM people, linking it to selection pressures on immune-related functions.
title: Genomic insights into the population history and biological adaptation of Southwestern Chinese Hmong-Mien people

finding: The SNP rs79301210 showed a significant iHS score of 3.3299, reinforcing its connection to selective pressures in HM people's immune system.
title: Genomic insights into the population history and biological adaptation of Southwestern Chinese Hmong-Mien people

finding: The SNP rs9947450 was identified as having a significant positive effect on energy portion size in short individuals, suggesting a role in dietary behaviors related to BMI; however, it was the only significant association found between height-specific variants and non-anthropometric traits.
title: Genome-wide analyses point to differences in genetic architecture of BMI between tall and short people

finding: The SNP rs763095261 was identified as part of the JK*A01W.05 allele, which was found to cause a null phenotype rather than a weak allele in one of the genotype-phenotype discrepancies observed in the study.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group using nanopore sequencing

finding: SNP rs2298720 was associated with the JK*A02W.04 allele and was found to likely cause a null allele effect, creating a discrepancy in phenotype despite being a common SNV with a minor allele frequency greater than 0.05.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group using nanopore sequencing

finding: The SNP rs1197896884 was identified in exon 7 and has been proposed as a novel null allele that contributed to genotype-phenotype discrepancies in the study.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group using nanopore sequencing

finding: SNP rs145283450 was noted for leading to null alleles such as JK*A01N.17 and JK*A02N.21, illustrating its relevance in genotype-phenotype discrepancies.
title: Resolving genotype-phenotype discrepancies of the Kidd blood group using nanopore sequencing

finding: The CD226 gene polymorphism rs763361 was linked to susceptibility to type 1 diabetes mellitus, again demonstrating genetic risk factors in autoimmune disorders.
title: Screening key genes and signaling pathways in COVID-19 infection and its associated complications by integrated bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs11081126 was identified as having a significant association with breast cancer susceptibility. In the paper cited, the authors discussed its role in the Hedgehog signaling pathway, implicating it in age-related biological processes observed in luminal epithelial cells of the mammary epithelium, which are linked to changes leading to cancer initiation.
title: Luminal epithelial cells integrate variable responses to aging into stereotypical changes that underlie breast cancer susceptibility

finding: This variant was associated with TTC39C, a protein relevant to cilia functions, providing insights into mechanisms potentially relevant to geographic atrophy.
title: Transcriptomic and proteomic retinal pigment epithelium signatures of age-related macular degeneration

finding: The variant rs12954879 was linked to the RNA stability of <italic>AQP4</italic> as a male-specific stQTL (FDR = 2e-05), showing that it influenced stability only in males.
title: Genetic variants associated mRNA stability in lung

finding: The SNP rs206435 showed associations in opposite directions for luminal A-like and triple-negative breast cancer, with odds ratios of 1.03 and 0.95 respectively, indicating its relevance in differentiating cancer subtypes.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies 32 novel breast cancer susceptibility loci from overall and subtype-specific analyses

finding: This SNP was located in the SERPINB10 gene, which demonstrated significant association with CL with a P-imputed value of 2.67×10^-6, suggesting a novel link to the disease.
title: A genome-wide association study highlights a regulatory role for IFNG-AS1 contributing to cutaneous leishmaniasis in Brazil

finding: The study by Zhang et al. (2015) identified a polymorphism in the RIT2 gene, specifically rs12456492, which was associated with an increased risk of developing Parkinson's disease. This finding highlighted the relevance of Rit2 in the pathophysiology of Parkinson's disease, providing a genetic insight into the mechanisms governing dopaminergic signaling and its implications for disease susceptibility.
title: Dopamine transporter trafficking and Rit2 GTPase: Mechanism of action and in vivo impact

finding: The rs12456492 polymorphism in the RIT2 gene was found to be associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's disease according to a meta-analysis conducted by Zhang et al. in 2015. This finding provided evidence that variations in RIT2 may influence dopaminergic signaling and could be relevant to the mechanisms underlying motor function and motor learning.
title: Presynaptic Gq-coupled receptors drive biphasic dopamine transporter trafficking that modulates dopamine clearance and motor function

finding: At the 18q11.2 locus, rs9955681 was located in an intron of the LAMA3 gene and was predicted to disrupt 67 different transcription factor binding site (TFBS) motifs. This SNP was found to be associated with high-grade serous ovarian cancer (HGSOC) and was categorized as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) in previous analyses, suggesting its critical role in gene regulation in EOC tumors.
title: Ovarian Cancer Risk Variants are Enriched in Histotype-Specific Enhancers that Disrupt Transcription Factor Binding Sites

finding: The SNP rs7240405 was associated with HDL in the Framingham Heart Study, highlighting its significance in that context.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: In contrast, rs7244811 was identified in the UK Biobank as being the most associated SNP with HDL instead of rs7240405 from the Framingham Heart Study, portraying a variant-level discrepancy due to model selection preferences.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: The intergenic SNP rs4939883 was found significant for HDL in the UK Biobank, indicating an alternate SNP contributing to the same trait compared to the Framingham cohort.
title: Multi-scale Inference of Genetic Trait Architecture using Biologically Annotated Neural Networks

finding: SNP rs11663049 was identified as an eSNP related to polyneuropathy in diabetes, which reduces risk for the condition while decreasing expression of CEP192 and possibly affecting the binding affinity of six activator transcription factors to its promoter in nmSCs.
title: NetREm Network Regression Embeddings reveal cell-type transcription factor coordination for gene regulation

finding: The SNP rs4987855 was found in linkage disequilibrium with a risk variant for NHL, suggesting a shared genetic background between lymphocytic leukemia and NHL.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs2278161 was recognized as a significant trans-eQTL associated with the target gene C1R in glioblastomas with a Bonferroni-adjusted p-value of 3.72 x 10^-3. The alternative C allele was linked to higher C1R expression levels. It was noted that this SNP caused a non-synonymous change in the CNDP2 protein, potentially leading to functional implications in tumor suppression pathways and through association with the PI3K/AKT pathway, further influencing C1R expression.
title: Discovering single-cell eQTLs from scRNA-seq data only

finding: The SNP rs76992529, which predisposes individuals of African descent to ATTR amyloidosis, was examined in the context of Cas9-targeting sites. It showed an average of 0.92% max variant effects on all associated Cas9-targeting sites, suggesting minimal impact on CRISPR/Cas9 editing efficiency. This indicated that editing efficiency would be comparable irrespective of alleles for this specific mutation, though variant-aware gRNA selection remained essential.
title: Widespread impact of natural genetic variations in CRISPR/Cas9 outcomes

finding: Associated with diet, this SNP lies near the MC4R gene, which is implicated in obesity protection. It showed significant GxE interactions, reinforcing its role in metabolic regulation.
title: Leveraging phenotypic variability to identify genetic interactions in human phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs4555225, associated with the risk haplotype, was found to significantly reduce the half-life of the lncRNA KILR, which acted as a tumor suppressor in breast cells. This reduction in half-life was linked to increased cell proliferation due to an increase in the available pool of RPA1, a key protein involved in DNA replication and repair. Thus, the presence of this risk variant altered cancer risk by influencing the expression dynamics of KILR.
title: CRISPR-Cas13d screens identify KILR, a breast cancer risk-associated lncRNA that regulates DNA replication and repair

finding: The rs7231304 variant within the AFG3L2 gene was associated with composite exercise response phenotypes. Although not previously linked to exercise, AFG3L2 mutations affect mitochondrial structure, potentially impairing training responses.
title: Identification of novel mitochondrial and mitochondrial related genetic loci associated with exercise response in the Gene SMART study

finding: The SNP rs11080920 was identified in a study conducted by Shah et al. (2019), which used a random forest machine learning approach to retrieve leaf chlorophyll content in wheat. This finding was significant because leaf chlorophyll content is an important trait related to plant health and productivity, thus impacting the overall yield and quality of wheat, aligning with the goals of breeding programs that focus on grain yield and quality traits.
title: Genomic Selection for End-Use Quality and Processing Traits in Soft White Winter Wheat Breeding Program with Machine and Deep Learning Models

finding: The SNP rs11081067 was identified as a significant genetic marker influencing lapatinib sensitivity in breast cancer. The mechanism was linked to the co-regulation of EP300 and SIRT1/6, impacting the acetylation and activity of the transcription factor FOXO3. This finding contributed to understanding how genetic variations can affect treatment outcomes in cancer therapy.
title: MAVEN: An R/Shiny app for compound mechanism of action analysis and visualisation using transcriptomics and compound structure data

finding: SNP rs17782313 showed association with obesity at a p-value of 3×10^-4; though associated without genome-wide significance, it corroborated findings from other studies.
title: A Comprehensive Genome-wide and Phenome-wide Examination of BMI and Obesity in a Northern Nevadan Cohort

finding: This SNP was linked to trans-eQTLs affecting 27 target genes, where 67% of these genes showed increased expression with the archaic allele. The finding indicated a significant regulatory influence through long-range effects associated with Neandertal DNA.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: The SNP rs11081184 was identified as a significant factor related to immune system responses, particularly in the context of TIMP-1-mediated chemoresistance in non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC). This finding indicated a relationship between this SNP and IL-6 induction, suggesting its potential relevance in predicting disease susceptibility and treatment responses.
title: Coordinated variation in the immune systems and microbiomes of healthy humans is linked to tonic interferon states

finding: The SNP rs12970134 was associated with obese polycystic ovary syndrome in patients from the Western region of Saudi Arabia. This finding highlighted the relevance of the MC4R gene variants in conditions related to obesity and reproductive disorders.
title: POMC neurons control fertility through differential signaling of MC4R in Kisspeptin neurons

finding: The SNP rs17782313 was similarly associated with obese polycystic ovary syndrome patients in the Western region of Saudi Arabia. This association further supported the role of MC4R variants in influencing both obesity and reproductive health.
title: POMC neurons control fertility through differential signaling of MC4R in Kisspeptin neurons

finding: This SNP demonstrated functional variations that enhanced its activity with ATRA treatment and was associated with perturbations in RXRA motifs, supporting its involvement in retinoid signaling pathways.
title: Transcriptional-Regulatory Convergence Across Functional MDD Risk Variants Identified by Massively Parallel Reporter Assays

finding: The SNP rs763361 within the CD226 gene was found to increase susceptibility to type 1 diabetes (T1D), multiple sclerosis (MS), and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). It was specifically noted that the Ser307 variant, encoded by the T allele of rs763361, might enhance cytoplasmic phosphorylation of CD226, thereby augmenting downstream signaling pathways that are crucial for T cell activation and proliferation.
title: Deletion of CD226 in Foxp3+ T cells Reduces Diabetes Incidence in Non-Obese Diabetic Mice by Improving Regulatory T Cell Stability and Function

finding: Was found to regulate BCL2 expression through ATU, implicating it in the hematopoietic signaling network.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs2272783 was classified as high PIP in the FECH gene and was linked to mean corpus hemoglobin, suggesting an impact on this phenotypic trait through splicing changes.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: The SNP rs8090080 was related to findings in a study by Sedgwick and D'Souza-Schorey (2016) that discussed the role of Wnt signaling in cell motility and invasion, drawing connections between developmental processes and cancer. This context highlighted the importance of Wnt signaling in cell behaviors that are critical for both normal embryonic development and pathological conditions such as cancer.
title: Wnt- and Glutamate-receptors orchestrate stem cell dynamics and asymmetric cell division

finding: This SNP mapped to the GNAL gene, which is highly expressed in the CNS and linked to cognitive deficits in bipolar disorder and schizophrenia. It was identified as the top SNP by XGBoost.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: This SNP, which was part of the GWAS analysis for PGS, had a p-value of 7.37016×10^-06, bordering on genome-wide significance, and also mapped to the GNAL gene.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: The SNP rs2272783 A>G in FECH was associated with erythropoietic protoporphyria and exhibited allele frequencies nearly three times higher in the Vietnamese and East Asia populations compared to the world population (28.10%, 32.57%, and 11.23%, respectively), emphasizing its notable prevalence in these regions.
title: Genetic profiling of Vietnamese population from large-scale genomic analysis of non-invasive prenatal testing data

finding: The SNP rs763361 in CD226 was identified as contributing to genetic susceptibility for type 1 diabetes, as it involved a Gly307Ser missense mutation, which was linked to increased autoimmune disease risk in affected individuals. This SNP was also associated with the phosphorylation dynamics of signaling molecules in T cells, indicating its relevance in T cell activation and function relevant to autoimmune processes.
title: Inhibition of CD226 Co-Stimulation Suppresses Diabetes Development in the NOD Mouse by Augmenting Tregs and Diminishing Effector T Cell Function

finding: Associated with the ALPK2 gene, rs76726049 was identified as having a strong impact specifically in CD14+ monocytes with predictive scores indicating significant regulatory actions in these cells. This variant did not overlap with microglia datasets, suggesting its regulatory influence is peripheral and specific to monocytes.
title: Regression convolutional neural network models implicate peripheral immune regulatory variants in the predisposition to Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The SNP rs613872 was found to have a strong association with Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD). This finding indicated that while there was a genetic susceptibility linked to this SNP, it did not result in changes in corneal endothelial TCF4 mRNA levels. The association highlighted the role of rs613872 as a genetic factor in the pathogenesis of FECD.
title: TCF4 trinucleotide repeat expansions and UV irradiation increase susceptibility to ferroptosis in Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy

finding: The SNP rs3764512 was nominated as the top candidate for major depressive disorder (MDD) through joint statistical fine-mapping across caQTL, eQTL, and GWAS signals. It was located within an open chromatin region at the transcription start site of the gene RAB27B, identified as relevant to the molecular etiology of MDD due to its role in synaptic transmission.
title: Genetic regulation of cell-type specific chromatin accessibility shapes the etiology of brain diseases

finding: The SNP rs11081074 was positively linked to the transcriptional roles of ALK fusion proteins in tumorigenesis. The findings suggested that alterations in gene expression mediated by ALK fusion proteins, which are commonly associated with various tumors, could be influenced by polymorphisms in this region. This connection highlighted the interplay between genetic variants and oncogenic processes, particularly in the context of T cell malignancies.
title: Requirement of DNMT1 to orchestrate epigenomic reprogramming during NPM-ALK driven T cell lymphomagenesis

finding: The rs12456492 variant in the RIT2 gene was associated with increased risk for Parkinson's disease (PD) and was linked to a positive correlation between RIT2 gene expression and brain pH in the substantia nigra. This association was confirmed through replication in the BrainEAC dataset, indicating that the effect of rs12456492 influenced the relationship between gene expression and pH specifically in this brain region, which is crucial to PD pathology. When examining ten brain regions, the interaction between pH, rs12456492, and gene expression of RIT2 was significantly observed only in the substantia nigra. Carriers of the A risk allele displayed a stronger positive correlation between gene expression and pH compared to the protective AA genotype. Additionally, a similar effect was noted for the neighboring SYT4 gene. However, this finding did not replicate in the GTEx dataset, which may be attributed to the shorter postmortem intervals of samples in that study.
title: A pH-eQTL interaction at the RIT2-SYT4 Parkinson’s disease risk locus in the substantia nigra

finding: Variant rs73392121 was located within a microglia scATAC peak and thought to regulate NPC intracellular cholesterol transporter 1 (NPC1). It led to reduced enhancer activity and was discussed concerning its implications in Niemann-Pick disease type C.
title: Massively parallel characterization of psychiatric disorder-associated and cell-type-specific regulatory elements in the developing human cortex

finding: Associated with HDL-C levels, this SNP was identified in the LIPG gene and confirmed as a previously known low-frequency variant affecting lipid levels.
title: Role of Rare and Low Frequency Variants in Gene-Alcohol Interactions on Plasma Lipid Levels

finding: The variant rs17758695 was associated with ATU in the BCL2 gene, underscoring its involvement in hematopoietic processes.
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The SNP rs6507874 at the SMAD7 locus was confirmed to have associations with both colon and rectal cancers, supporting its role in colorectal cancer susceptibility.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The rs12456492 polymorphism in the RIT2 gene was associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's disease, as revealed by a meta-analysis conducted by Zhang et al. in 2015. This finding suggested that genetic variations affecting the RIT2 gene may play a significant role in the susceptibility to Parkinson's disease.
title: Dopamine transporter trafficking and Rit2 GTPase: Mechanism of action and in vivo impact

finding: The study indicated that women with the common MC4R SNP rs17782313 experienced greater long-term weight gain, increased risk of diabetes, and emotional eating. This finding highlighted the role of MC4R in metabolic health and sex-differences related to estrogen signaling.
title: Estrogen Drives Melanocortin Neurons To Reduce Sedentary Behavior

finding: The study reported that the RIT2 rs12456492 polymorphism was associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's disease. This association highlighted the significance of RIT2 in neuropsychiatric conditions and suggested that genetic variations in this locus could play a critical role in the pathophysiology of Parkinson's disease.
title: Dopamine transporter trafficking and Rit2 GTPase: In vivo impact and mechanism of action

finding: The rs12456492 polymorphism in the RIT2 gene was associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's disease, according to a meta-analysis conducted by Zhang et al. in 2015. This finding indicated that genetic variations in the RIT2 gene could influence dopaminergic pathways and conditions related to dopamine signaling and potentially dopaminergic behaviors, linking it to the broader context of dopamine's role in motor function and neurodegeneration.
title: Presynaptic Gq-coupled receptors drive biphasic dopamine transporter trafficking that modulates dopamine clearance and motor function

finding: The SNP rs8090962 was located within an enhancer region approximately 100KB downstream of SEC11C and 50KB upstream of ZNF532, and it was significantly associated with diastolic blood pressure (DBP), although neither of these genes had prior associations with blood pressure traits.
title: Gene-environment interactions using a Bayesian whole genome regression model

finding: As the top SNP from a GWAS of diabetic retinopathy (DR), rs9966620 resided in an intron of TTC39C. It was found most accessible in rod photoreceptors and linked to the expression of multiple target genes through a 3D chromatin interaction. Its connectivity with TTC39C-AS1 suggested a role in modulating DR risk.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: A strong effect of the T allele at rs28630791 was noted on the expression of the DSC1 gene specifically in mid-pubertal females. DSC1 encodes desmocollin 1, relevant to cell junction integrity and immune functions.
title: Analysis of transcriptional changes in the immune system associated with pubertal development in a longitudinal cohort of children with asthma

finding: The bQTL and caQTL rs993767 revealed significant associations with chromatin dynamics at the CCBE1 locus, further linking it to vascular functions implicated in CAD.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The caQTL rs3114275 was shown to affect chromatin accessibility at the CCBE1 locus, contributing to the understanding of its role in CAD-related regulatory networks.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapped for TCF21 binding, chromatin accessibility and chromosomal looping in coronary artery smooth muscle cells reveal molecular mechanisms of coronary disease loci

finding: The SNP rs12456492 was associated with an increased risk of Parkinson's disease (PD) across several studies. It was identified as a risk allele linked to PD susceptibility in Asian populations, as reported in a meta-analysis by Lu et al. (2015) and further confirmed in other studies, such as the work by Liu et al. (2015) and Zhang et al. (2015). These studies indicated that the presence of this polymorphism could influence the likelihood of developing PD.
title: Rit2 silencing in dopamine neurons drives a progressive Parkinsonian phenotype

finding: The SNP rs9960767 was associated with schizophrenia and was found to reside within a super-FIRE. This super-FIRE demonstrated highly frequent local chromatin interactions and largely overlapped with the gene TCF4, which played an important role in neurodevelopment. The analysis suggested that chromatin spatial organization could be significant in gene regulation at this locus, potentially elucidating the mechanism by which rs9960767 influences the risk for schizophrenia.
title: FIREcaller: Detecting Frequently Interacting Regions from Hi-C Data

finding: The SNP rs11081178 was linked to the role of p21 in cancer research, particularly its involvement in cell cycle regulation and its expression changes in response to therapeutic interventions, including that of rosmarinic acid in MB.
title: Modulation of Viability, Proliferation, and Stemness by Rosmarinic Acid in Medulloblastoma Cells: Involvement of HDACs and EGFR

finding: rs12955474 reached Bonferroni-corrected significance with a beta of 0.17 and p-value of 8.1 × 10^-5. This SNP was previously reported in a GWAS for the third principal component on hearing thresholds across various frequencies, where it showed a beta of -0.10 and p-value of 3.57 × 10^-7.
title: Genome-wide association study and polygenic risk score analysis for hearing measures in children

finding: Noted for its extremely high PIP (> 99%) for monocyte, platelet, and red blood cell counts, rs17758695 has been previously reported to resonate with regulatory landscapes across multiple progenitor cell types.
title: Mapping enhancer-gene regulatory interactions from single-cell data

finding: The SNP rs12454712 was identified as a fine-mapped variant for insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) and type 2 diabetes. It was found within an intronic enhancer of the BCL2 gene, which encodes an anti-apoptotic transcription factor. This variant's location in a regulatory region of pituitary stem cells and somatotropes indicated a potential role in pituitary stem cell differentiation, while both high and low IGF-1 levels have been connected to insulin resistance and increased risk of type 2 diabetes.
title: Single-cell multiome regression models identify functional and disease-associated enhancers and enable chromatin potential analysis

finding: As detailed in the context of rs12454712, this SNP was fine-mapped for insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) and type 2 diabetes, located within a regulatory intronic enhancer of the BCL2 gene, highlighting its potential influence on cell apoptosis rates and diabetes risk.
title: Single-cell multiome regression models identify functional and disease-associated enhancers and enable chromatin potential analysis

finding: The study identified a risk gene variant of meprin beta, rs173032, which was linked to Alzheimer's disease through whole-exome sequencing of the BDR cohort. This finding correlates with the previously established role of meprin beta as an alternative beta-secretase involved in the generation of aggregation-prone amyloid beta peptides, supporting its impact on Alzheimer’s disease pathogenesis.
title: The Alzheimer’s disease associated bacterial protease RgpB from P. gingivalis activates the alternative β-secretase meprin β thereby increasing Aβ generation

finding: The SNP rs7244213, located in the urea transporter gene SLC14A2, was found to associate with 17 distinct anatomical, physiological, and physical activity features that could help differentiate between the Kapha, Pitta, and Vata Prakriti types.
title: Genetic differences between extreme and composite constitution types from whole exome sequences reveal actionable variations

finding: The rs11083046 SNP at chr18:51781019, with the variant C allele, was found to increase enhancer activity by 30% compared to the reference T allele, with a significance p value of 0.00367.
title: Optimized high-throughput screening of non-coding variants identified from genome-wide association studies

finding: rs201123820 exhibited a genome-wide significant difference between opioid dependence (OD) cases and unexposed controls with a z-score of 5.55 and a p-value of 2.9x10^-8. It was identified in the African-ancestry meta-analysis and showed significant associations with musculoskeletal disorders in the UK Biobank.
title: Leveraging genome-wide data to investigate differences between opioid use vs. opioid dependence in 41,176 individuals from the Psychiatric Genomics Consortium

finding: The SNP rs151344523 was reported to be located within the deleted region of the AFG3L2 gene in patient NEI_328, who exhibited symptoms of cone-rod dystrophy. Given that the deletion affecting this gene was detected and no such alterations were present in population databases, the presence of this SNP aligns with a known pathogenic variant context relating to autosomal dominant optic atrophy 12.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: Similar to rs151344523, rs151344522 was also found in the deleted region of AFG3L2, which was identified in the patient presenting with cone-rod dystrophy symptoms. The absence of this deletion in population databases supports the hypothesis of a potential pathogenic role associated with this variant.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: The SNP rs151344520 was documented within the AFG3L2 deletion that was discovered in patient NEI_328. Its relation to the disease phenotype strengthens the argument for its pathogenic potential, given the context of the clinical diagnosis of autosomal dominant optic atrophy 12.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: Found within the same deletion as AFG3L2, rs797045221 was identified in the context of patient NEI_328's genetic profile. The relevance of this SNP is underscored by its connection to known pathogenic variants reported in ClinVar, indicative of its involvement in the patient's disease manifestation.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: The SNP rs151344514, like others in this analysis, appeared in the deletion affecting AFG3L2 in patient NEI_328. Given the clinical context and reports of pathogenic variants localized in the same region, this SNP was also likely associated with the observed cone-rod dystrophy.
title: Systematic assessment of the contribution of structural variants to inherited retinal diseases

finding: The research established that the RIT2 rs12456492 polymorphism was linked to an increased risk of developing Parkinson's disease, as evidenced by a meta-analysis completed by Zhang et al. in 2015. This finding indicated that individuals with certain variations of this SNP may have altered DA signaling and DAT regulation, supporting a role for RIT2 in dopaminergic neurotransmission.
title: Dopamine transporter trafficking and Rit2 GTPase: Mechanism of action and in vivo impact

finding: Located in the MOCOS gene, this SNP exhibited a significant GxS interaction in SCZ (p=1.48×10−7) and was associated with expression in vascular endothelial cells.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The SNP rs1788098 demonstrated a significant NK cell-specific eQTL effect on CD226 expression. This effect indicated that reduced expression of CD226 increased the risk of autoimmune diseases, particularly type-1 diabetes (T1DM) and inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). The strong association (p = 1.92 x 10^-19) highlighted the relevance of CD226 in regulating NK cell responses to autoimmune phenomena.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: As an exact proxy for rs1788098, the SNP rs1788097 was associated with autoimmune diseases and haematological indices. It was highlighted in GWAS findings with significance (p < 5 x 10^-8), confirming its role in autoimmune risk alongside rs1788098.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The locus containing STAT3 displayed co-localization with accessible chromatin regions in fibroblasts, specifically indicated by an ATAC peak detected uniquely in rectum maps. This finding suggested tissue dependence for the regulation of STAT3.
title: Accessible chromatin maps of inflammatory bowel disease intestine nominate cell-type mediators of genetic disease risk

finding: The rs2298645 was identified as a nonsynonymous SNP that led to the disappearance of a trypsin cleavage site in the HSBP1L1 gene, which encodes a missing protein. The allele substitution G>T resulted in a longer peptide. This SNP had a high frequency of ~81% in the overall population, as reported in various genetic databases, but was noted to have no clinical relevance.
title: Human Chr18: “Stakhanovite” Genes, Missing and uPE1 Proteins in Liver Tissue and HepG2 Cells

finding: The SNP rs11665282 was highlighted as the most significant in schizophrenia, residing within the MOCOS gene, with a GxS interaction (p=1.48×10^-7) supporting its role in vascular endothelial cell-related functions.
title: Sex-Dependent Shared and Non-Shared Genetic Architecture Across Mood and Psychotic Disorders

finding: The SNP rs2847408 was associated with bipolar disorder in the context of CSF metabolite aspartic acid in the intergenic region nearby the CDH2 gene, showing a novel association without evidence of prior genome-wide significance.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs4798131 in the DLGAP1 gene was associated with everyday drinking in the study population. The DLGAP1 gene previously was not shown to associate with alcohol behavior, but had links to schizophrenia and other brain diseases.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: This SNP was associated with volume-related imaging phenotypes and had a genome-wide significant association result confirmed by the analysis of subcortical volumes.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analyses of the brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs11081126 was linked to the Hedgehog signaling pathway, which was proposed as a viable target in breast cancer. The findings indicated that this SNP might play a significant role in understanding breast cancer initiation, especially in the context of aging and the lineage fidelity of mammary epithelial cells.
title: Luminal epithelial cells integrate variable responses to aging into stereotypical changes that underlie breast cancer susceptibility

finding: For the SNP rs79143095, the gene TNFRSF11A (ENSG00000105641) demonstrated differential regulation in monocytes. The analysis revealed that the effect size for this gene was the same direction for both lithium users and nonusers, albeit with significantly different magnitudes.
title: Cell type deconvolution of bulk blood RNA-Seq to reveal biological insights of neuropsychiatric disorders

finding: The SNP rs763361 (G307S) within the CD226 gene was found to increase susceptibility to multiple autoimmune diseases, particularly type 1 diabetes (T1D), multiple sclerosis (MS), and rheumatoid arthritis (RA). This variant was associated with enhanced signaling due to a potential additional phosphorylation site, contributing to the pathogenesis of these diseases.
title: Deletion of CD226 in Foxp3+ T cells Reduces Diabetes Incidence in Non-Obese Diabetic Mice by Improving Regulatory T Cell Stability and Function

finding: Associated with colon and rectal cancers, this SNP was linked to SMAD7 at 18q21.1.
title: Pan-Cancer Study Detects Novel Genetic Risk Variants and Shared Genetic Basis in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) rs613872 was found to have a strong association with Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD). This finding suggested that rs613872 plays a significant role in the genetic background of FECD, although it did not correspond with changes in corneal endothelial TCF4 mRNA levels. The context of this finding relates to the disease's pathogenesis, emphasizing the genetic contribution to susceptibility to FECD.
title: TCF4 trinucleotide repeat expansions and UV irradiation are associated with ferroptosis susceptibility in Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy

finding: The SNP rs10502437 exhibited colocalisation between GWAS and low-grade cartilage molecular QTLs, indicating a significant association where the risk allele was correlated with an increase in gene expression in patients with osteoarthritis. This result highlights its potential role in the molecular mechanisms underlying the disease.
title: Decoding the genomic basis of osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs7241221 in the GALNT1 locus was identified as having a significant association with serum sclerostin levels, displaying a beta of 0.109 SD change per G allele with a p-value of 4.40 x 10^-11. This association further supports the relationship between genetic variants in GALNT1 and bone phenotypes.
title: Mendelian Randomization analysis reveals a causal influence of circulating sclerostin levels on bone mineral density and fractures

finding: The study indicated that the SNP rs11081067 was associated with modulation of FOXO3 acetylation and activity, which was implicated in influencing lapatinib sensitivity in breast cancer. This finding was significant in the context of understanding the genetic factors that may affect therapeutic responses to lapatinib.
title: MAVEN: Compound mechanism of action analysis and visualisation using transcriptomics and compound structure data in R/Shiny

finding: The SNP rs79783591, a rare missense variant at the MC4R locus, was associated with obesity. It was absent in the gnomAD browser but had an overall frequency of 1.1% in the Mexico City Prospective Study, with an inferred frequency of 1.6% in Native Mexican populations and frequencies of less than 0.05% in both African and European populations.
title: Genotyping, sequencing and analysis of 140,000 adults from the Mexico City Prospective Study

finding: The SNP rs9960767 was associated with schizophrenia risk, particularly noted for its impact on sensorimotor gating, which was observed in both schizophrenia spectrum patients and healthy individuals. This finding underscored the potential role of TCF4 in neurodevelopmental disorders.
title: Tcf4 Deficiency Causes Recurrent Seizures in Mice

finding: The SNP rs9960767 was found within a super-FIRE region characterized by frequent local chromatin interactions. This region was noted for its overlap with schizophrenia-associated findings from a GWAS, particularly relating to the gene TCF4, which is important for neurodevelopment. The study suggested that chromatin spatial organization might influence gene regulation in the area where rs9960767 is located, potentially clarifying mechanisms through which this SNP contributes to schizophrenia risk.
title: FIREcaller: an R package for detecting frequently interacting regions from Hi-C data

finding: The SNP rs11081128 was linked to the therapeutic targeting of heterogeneous CSC populations in breast cancer. Its involvement indicated potential variations in therapeutic responses, emphasizing the need to understand such SNPs in devising effective combination therapies.
title: Blocking Gi/o-coupled signaling eradicates cancer stem cells and sensitizes breast tumors to HER2-targeted therapies to inhibit tumor relapse

finding: The SNP rs61751192 was located in the upstream region of the Alk gene and exhibited melting at 1 day following cocaine exposure. However, by 14 days, the melting behavior of this region was inconsistent, reverting to a pre-melted state in one of the replicates while remaining decondensed in another. This SNP was tied to chromatin dynamics following a single cocaine exposure, highlighting its potential impact on gene regulation in relation to cocaine addiction.
title: A single dose of cocaine rewires the 3D genome structure of midbrain dopamine neurons

finding: rs8084351 was identified as an eQTL affecting the DCC gene, showing a strong GWS association in the meta-analysis (p=2.39×10⁻⁹) for both ADHD and MDD. It also weakly associated with ADHD and MDD individually at subthreshold levels but contributed significantly to the meta-analysis results, suggesting its role in the genetic overlap of the two disorders.
title: Investigating regions of shared genetic variation in attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder and major depressive disorder: A GWAS meta-analysis

finding: The study reported a significant association between the SNP rs7235957 and multiple CpG sites in the ENOSF1 promoter region. This association was the strongest among the analyzed variants, with a p-value of 1.47×10^{-38}, indicating a strong statistical relationship within the context of DNA methylation associated with shear stress in advanced atherosclerotic plaques.
title: Exploring the Causal Effects of Shear Stress Associated DNA Methylation on Cardiovascular Risk

finding: The SNP rs2571244, located on chromosome 18 upstream of the ATP8B1 gene, was identified as significantly associated with Combined Resilience in cognitively normal individuals, with a minor allele frequency of 0.08 and a p-value of 2.3×10^-8. Analysis revealed that the minor allele was linked to lower levels of Combined Resilience (β=-0.11). Additionally, this SNP was strongly associated with methylation at multiple sites in prefrontal cortex tissue, including a site just upstream of ATP8B1 (cg19596477) with a highly significant p-value of 2×10^-13. The findings suggested that genetic variations may predispose some individuals toward cognitive resilience despite neurodegenerative pathology, implicating a role of bile acid metabolism and vascular health.
title: Genetic Variants and Functional Pathways Associated with Resilience to Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The study indicated that rs335929 was implicated in cognitive decline in Alzheimer's patients, establishing a link with cognitive performance during prolonged wakefulness.
title: Haplotype of the astrocytic water channel AQP4 modulates slow wave energy in human NREM sleep

finding: The SNP rs7239151 showed context-dependent eQTL effects on CYB5A expression, where higher blue module scores in B cells correlated with higher CYB5A expression for the GG genotype, indicating modulation of the variant's effects by B cell activation.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: The SNP rs57631119 functioned as an eQTL for SMAD2 in CD4+ T cm cells and was associated with asthma in GWAS, thus indicating its potential relevance in TGFβ-SMAD2 signaling within asthmatic pathways.
title: Single-cell analysis of human diversity in circulating immune cells

finding: This SNP showed an association with RMM and was located in the PTPRM gene at the 18p11.23 region, with a p-value of 3.77×10−8.
title: First genome-wide association study of non-severe malaria in two birth cohorts in Benin

finding: The intronic variant rs2272783 in FECH had a high PIP of 0.989, indicating a strong association with mean corpus hemoglobin levels.
title: Large scale functional screen identifies genetic variants with splicing effects in modern and archaic humans

finding: This SNP was part of a region along 18q.21.2 that contained three independently-associated variants and was associated with the Transcription Factor 4 (TCF4) gene which had a p-value of 4.55 x 10^-16.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of depression identifies 102 independent variants and highlights the importance of the prefrontal brain regions

finding: This SNP was one of three independently-associated variants located near the TCF4 and RAB27B genes, with RAB27B exhibiting significant association with depression (p = 1.39 x 10^-9).
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of depression identifies 102 independent variants and highlights the importance of the prefrontal brain regions

finding: Similar to rs62091461 and rs12966052, this SNP was part of the independently-associated variants situated near TCF4 and RAB27B, further supporting the genetic basis for depression.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of depression identifies 102 independent variants and highlights the importance of the prefrontal brain regions

finding: This SNP also tagged variants related to neuroticism and broadly defined depression, confirming its association in past GWAS.
title: Multivariate GWAS of psychiatric disorders and their cardinal symptoms reveal two dimensions of cross-cutting genetic liabilities

finding: The SNP rs4987855 was linked to lymphocytic leukemia PRS and had a high linkage disequilibrium with an NHL risk variant, suggesting a potential shared genetic pathway for B-cell malignancies.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: This SNP's association with NHL was supported by its linkage with the lymphocytic leukemia PRS, highlighting common risk factors pertinent to both NHL and chronic lymphocytic leukemia.
title: Cross-Cancer Evaluation of Polygenic Risk Scores for 17 Cancer Types in Two Large Cohorts

finding: The SNP rs613872, associated with the gene ZEB1, was linked to late onset Fuchs endothelial corneal dystrophy (FECD) in patients from northern India. This finding helped establish a genetic association relevant to the disease phenotype, indicating that changes in this SNP might contribute to the pathogenesis of FECD.
title: Characterization of a novel mouse model for Fuchs Endothelial Corneal Dystrophy

finding: SNP rs145619574 near the WDR7 gene was identified in a narrowed cohort of ASD patients, marking its association with heart developmental anomalies.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: Similarly, SNP rs72917381 located near WDR7 was found significant in patients with ASD type II, indicating its potential role in the phenotype.
title: Genome-wide association study in European patients with congenital heart disease identifies risk loci for transposition of the great arteries and anomalies of the thoracic arteries and veins and expression of discovered candidate genes in the developing heart

finding: The research by Zhang et al. (2015) established a correlation between the RIT2 rs12456492 polymorphism and an increased risk of developing Parkinson's disease. This finding underscored the relevance of RIT2 in DAergic systems, linking genetic variation at this locus to neuropsychiatric disorders, particularly concerning dopamine dysregulation and the pathogenic mechanisms involved in Parkinson's disease.
title: Dopamine transporter trafficking and Rit2 GTPase: In vivo impact and mechanism of action

finding: The SNP rs1893217 in the PTPN2 gene was found to promote increased expression of the SARS-CoV-2 receptor ACE2, facilitating cellular entry of the virus. This relationship was established through experiments using various human intestinal and lung epithelial cell lines, as well as Ptpn2-deficient mouse models. The finding demonstrated that the presence of the risk 'C' allele in individuals was associated with higher ACE2 expression levels, which were mediated by increased JAK-STAT signaling.
